title: Sausage, Potato and Kale Soup Recipe
description: This sausage and kale soup combines pork sausage, nutritious kale, and potatoes to give a hearty, rich, bold flavor to a creamy Italian-inspired soup.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Cream Soup Recipes Sausage, Potato and Kale Soup 4.7 (624) 508 Reviews 167 Photos Creamy sausage and kale soup with potatoes, onion, and herbs that's full of flavor and delicious nourishment. Submitted by Dianna Jacobs-Fresh Updated on January 17, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 167 167 167 167 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 50 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 pound bulk Italian sausage 4 cups half-and-half 3 cups cubed potatoes 2 cups low-sodium chicken broth 2 cups whole milk 1 medium onion, chopped ½ teaspoon dried oregano ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes, or more to taste ½ teaspoon ground black pepper 2 cups kale, torn into bite-sized pieces Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Crumble sausage into the pot; cook and stir until browned, about 10 minutes. Drain and discard grease. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir half-and-half, potatoes, chicken broth, milk, onion, oregano, and pepper flakes into sausage, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Season with black pepper. Stir in kale; simmer until kale is tender, 10 to 15 more minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,248 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 266 Calories 18g Fat 16g Carbs 11g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 266 % Daily Value * Total Fat 18g 23% Saturated Fat 9g 46% Cholesterol 50mg 17% Sodium 391mg 17% Total Carbohydrate 16g 6% Dietary Fiber 2g 5% Total Sugars 3g Protein 11g 21% Vitamin C 23mg 26% Calcium 162mg 12% Iron 1mg 6% Potassium 488mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sausage, Potato and Kale Soup 01 of 167 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 167 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 03/12/2025 While this is a good base recipe, I recommend browning the onions in some of the sausage fat along with adding the spices to the onion to bloom them and develop those flavors. Personally, I think this is too much dairy, so I opt in for adding three cups of chicken stock, and having the option of adding half and half per serving.The recipe doesn’t call for salt but I also recommend adding salt as you go and at the end. Feel free to double up on the spices and add mince garlic and garlic powder as well to develop a more complex flavor. Without salt, it would have been bland to be honest.I do love this recipe overall though because it allows you to just build on it to your liking! 03 of 167 Photo by  LimeBean8582 12/06/2024 A keeper! Great flavors I decided to brown the onions with the sausage, which brought out more flavors. I also added fresh rosemary. Delicious! 04 of 167 Photo by  dells1978 12/27/2023 It was so good. Thank you for sharing. I used ground turkey. Also, I used half the whip. 05 of 167 Photo by  My Hot Southern Mess 09/25/2023 I made this as written, ingredient wise. Cooking method, I used my instant pot. As written, like many others have said, it is on the bland side. It was also not as creamy as we would have liked. With tweaks it has potential, as is it wasn't for us. 06 of 167 Photo by  FlimsyBacon4136 12/05/2022 I loved this recipe. The only thing different I did was use pork sausage instead of Italian red potatoes, plus I had to improvise by using garlic powder, and onion powder. I didn't know I was out. I think it would be excellent if I had actually used onion and minced garlic, but it was still delicious. I also, used whipping cream instead of half an half. I suggest this recipe to anyone who wants great tasting easy to make soup. Easy on the wallet also!! Thank you for sharing it with us!! 07 of 167 Photo by  Baron L Howell 04/05/2022 I made it with some slight alterations ... I added more kill more potatoes and more seasoning ...It came out delicious ... I will make it again with a few adjustments ... 08 of 167 Photo by  mcooks 04/21/2021 09 of 167 Photo by  franklinl831 04/21/2021 10 of 167 Photo by  franklinl831 04/21/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Almost Tuscan Sausage and Kale Soup 106 Ratings Spicy and Creamy Vegetable Soup 17 Ratings Hungarian Potato and Sausage Soup 90 Ratings Caldo Verde (Portuguese Sausage Kale Soup) 65 Ratings Red Winter Minestrone with Winter Greens Pesto Curried Potato and Spinach Soup 3 Ratings Kartoffelsuppe nach Bayrischer Art (Bavarian Potato Soup) 8 Ratings Lentil, Kale, and Sausage Soup 4 Ratings Portuguese Sausage and Kale Soup (Caldo Verde) 3 Ratings Potato, Spinach, and Leek Soup 3 Ratings Keto Caldo Verde with Chorizo 3 Ratings Potato and Sausage Soup 18 Ratings Cabbage and Corned Beef Chowder 31 Ratings Potato, Fennel, and Bacon Soup O'Cheeze Potato Soup 5 Ratings Italian Vegetable Soup with Beans, Spinach & Pesto 75 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Dianna Jacobs-Fresh
